title: 110_s454
content: The Act may be cited as the "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" and includes an increase in Federal Pell Grants. Amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 increases Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 amendment allocates $4,331,000,000 for the academic year 2007-2008 to increase Federal Pell Grants by $1,050. Effective July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for the taxable year is set at $3,750, with an increase in phaseout limits to $75,000 ($150,000). Additionally, a conforming amendment adjusts the amounts for inflation after 2007. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The sunset provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 do not apply to the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. Coverdell Education Savings Accounts amended to increase allowable contributions to $3,000. Reports filing deadline extended to June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for modifications to education individual retirement accounts. SEC. 5. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for employer-provided educational assistance. SEC. 5. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for employer-provided educational assistance. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 shall not apply to section 411, extending the exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance.
